In true, traditional Judaism, Magic does exist. We shouldn't practice it, probably for fear of exactly what they're saying here, that people might turn away and it's easier to control people if they only believe what you want them to, but there's nothing inherently against magic. Kabbalah is essentially magic. The belief his neck, given the proper incantation and using the right words, you can essentially create anything. That's why names have such power. And God created the world in six days through speech

As I recently read when looking into James RandI (who apparently died last year?), true cynicism is fully opening your mind and suspending all disbelief. It also means that, until you've been shown definitive proof, you can't accept something is true. Those two go hand-in-hand.
